{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.17645v1", "title": "A common first integral from three-body secular theory and Kepler
  billiards", "summary": "We observe that a particular first integral of the partially-averaged system
in the secular theory of the three-body problem appears also as an important
conserved quantity of integrable Kepler billiards. In this note we illustrate
their common roots with the projective dynamics of the two-center problem. We
then combine these two aspects to define a class of integrable billiard systems
on surfaces of constant curvature.", "main_category": "math.DS", "categories": "math.DS", "published": "2025-04-24T15:14:21Z"}
